results.title: DriveBid Sales Executive
results.description:
Company Description

DriveBid, a division of DrivenIQ, is the only live trade-in marketplace where dealers compete to buy your vehicle. DriveBid connects consumers who want the best offer for their trade-in with dealers who need inventory in a real-time, easy-to-use online platform. Dealers configure criteria for the vehicles they need and compete with live bids or make cash offers for vehicles that match these criteria. Consumers launch their trades in an open competitive platform, communicate with dealers and get offers for their trades, all in real-time. 

DriveBid simultaneously captures key vehicle and consumer data to help dealers make smart vehicle buying and inventory management decisions in the future. Our team has 30+ years of experience in the auto industry.



Job Description

What you’ll do:

We're looking for a remote employee to work out of the state of Michigan.  As a DriveBid Sales Executive, you will be responsible for creating, building and promoting brand awareness in an assigned territory for the DriveBid brand. You will also be responsible for generating new sales business and maximizing transaction with both dealerships and consumers.

Your weekly goals: Identify new prospect opportunities with dealers and events to attend to promote awareness to consumers. Present demonstrations on the DriveBid product, present cost and sign-up retailers. Help auto dealers find and buy more used car trades and help consumers sell their car more efficiently for the most competitive offer. You’ll become the primary point of contact when a client signs up for our program and will work closely with the customer support team to retain that business.

Your role will be to establish trust with all our customers in your portfolio and show the value of the DriveBid solutions to make them partners not just customers for life. 



Qualifications

What you’ll need:

To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to individuals with medical conditions to perform the essential functions.

  • BS/BA in Marketing, Business Administration, or another related field preferred but not required
  • 4-5+ years of car sales, internet sales or business development sales experience; used car sales preferred
  • Track record of successfully achieving monthly sales or new prospect goals
  • A deep understanding of the retail automotive landscape, new cars vs used car sales, CRMs, and how dealers’ business units operate & market
  • Digital marketing and automotive advertising experience a plus
  • Experience working with used car trade platforms preferred; KAR Global, Carvana, AutoTrader
  • Experience working sales by phone and virtual meetings using Zoom, Teams, Webex
  • This position is remote, so you will be expected to be a self-starter, and provide detailed activity and performance of your daily results in Salesforce, etc.
  • Independent problem-solving skills and adaptivity to change
  • You’re a people-person! You love talking to people and building lasting relationships
  • Know how to communicate strategies to show value in products
  • Ability to build solid relationships, provide excellent customer service, and create the consultative environment
  • Strong collaboration & teamwork skills. You’ll need to partner closely with your team and your clients
  • You can easily manage multiple tasks in a well-organized and highly detailed manner while working in a fast-paced, perpetually evolving, relationship-driven environment
  • Stay up to date with automotive industry trends
  • Travel will be required to dealers three days a week and to events
  • Other duties may be assigned by supervisor


Additional Information

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Pay
  • Holidays + Unlimited PTO. It’s all about balance and we trust you will get your work done!
  • Medical, Dental, Vision plans available
  • Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Plans, Company Sponsored
  • Complimentary $25k Basic Life Insurance and AD&D
  • Learning and growth opportunities
  • Remote work - work comfortably from your home

This job advertisement in no way states or implies that these are the only duties and responsibilities to be performed by this employee. A full job description will be provided if and when a job offer is presented. The employee will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties and responsibilities upon the request of a supervisor.

DriveBid is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

results.title: Performance Marketing Manager
results.description:
About In Good Taste:

In Good Taste was started in Sonoma County with a goal of providing high quality wines in beautiful 187ml glass bottles to customers across the United States. Since we launched our eCommerce site two years ago, we have sold 2 million bottles and hosted thousands of private and corporate tasting events.

About the Performance Marketing Manager:

The Performance Marketing Manager will report directly to the CRO to lead strategy, execution, analysis and optimization of IGT's marketing and communication channels. You will be responsible for the top of the marketing funnel to drive awareness and visitors to our website. You will be responsible for deploying ad dollars and maximizing profitable returns.

Role and responsibilities:

  • Create, manage, analyze, and adjust our digital marketing strategy
  • Lead development of audience retention strategy, journeys and tactics
  • Lead management of digital media process from planning, budgeting, strategy, promotion.
  • Set up, manage, and optimize all digital media campaigns and programs, including budget management and campaign performance Including, but not limited to SEM, programmatic and social
  • Manage copywriting for ad campaigns and website landing pages, utilizing full-time and part-time resources as well as contributing your own copy samples when necessary to provide direction to others
  • Analyze and interpret data and make recommendations to enhance overall campaign performance (including budget recommendations)
  • Create Email and SMS campaigns for all stages of the customer journey
  • Manage promotional calendar and activity plan across all digital D2C channels.
  • Prepare accurate reports on our marketing campaign's overall performance

About You

  • You have a holistic marketing experience, including but not limited to brand marketing, product marketing, communications, content and SEO strategy, social media, demand generation, and performance marketing
  • Minimum 5 years marketing experience with a brand that has generated $5mm+ per year in sales  
  • Proven experience deploying ad dollars profitably through DTC channels
  • A keen understanding and passion for Brand (Product Marketing, Brand, and Content)
  • Proven experience within the eCommerce, marketplace, or direct-to-consumer space
  • Experience running SMS and email marketing campaigns through Klayvio
  • Early adopter and problem solver for digital platforms, you are comfortable exploring new tools and platforms and adapting to process improvements.
  • Proven ability to work under pressure, prioritize work, and balance a portfolio of projects
  • Excellent writing and editing skills with an eye for design

Benefits and Perks:

  • Did we mention...wine?
  • Comprehensive company-sponsored healthcare plan, including dental and vision
  • HSA and FSA options
  • Access to complimentary OneMedical membership
  • Access to RightWay personal care concierge to help navigate the healthcare system
  • Access to discounted pet insurance policies
  • Company-sponsored Short Term Disability and Long Term Disability coverage
  • Unlimited paid time off policy
  • Competitive base salary

Note: In an industry that has historically lacked diversity, we are committed to working towards a more diverse and inclusive workforce. We encourage individuals from underrepresented groups to apply to any of our roles.

results.title: Senior Software Engineer, Assessment Platform
results.description:
The Role

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer who wants to be an impactful part of a small team looking to change the way technical hiring is done. In this role, you will be an integral part of our Assessment Platform Engineering team.

The Assessment Platform team forms a bridge between the interview content powering CodeSignal's Skills Evaluation Frameworks and the Pre-Screen, Tech Screen, and Interview products that delight our customers. Engineers in Assessment Platform interact frequently with Product Engineers and Technical Assessment Developers throughout the organization, and work on parts of the codebase that encompass both content creation and user interaction with the platform.

The Company

CodeSignal is the leading technical interview and assessment solution, helping companies identify the right candidates with the right skills—even if they don’t have the “right” profile. Hiring and selection teams use CodeSignal to increase speed-to-hire and candidate pipeline yield, and tap into underrepresented pools of candidates. Founded in 2014, CodeSignal is trusted by leading companies like Netflix, Capital One, Robinhood, and Dropbox. Some of our recent accomplishments include:
  • Becoming an Industry Leader in G2's Technical Screening Software Category, 2022
  • Winning BuiltIn Best Places to Work: Small Companies in SF 2022 award
  • Getting Certified as a Best Place to Work 2021-2022
  • Raising $50M in our Series C led by Index Ventures in 2021
  • Raising $25M in our Series B led by Menlo Ventures in late 2020
  • Coming in at #3 on SaaS Mag’s “SaaS 1000” list in 2020

What makes a Signalite?

Signalites are the incredible people who make up CodeSignal’s global team. We believe every Signalite should be given the context to understand decisions, the freedom to act independently, and the responsibility to do what’s right. These principles build upon each other to drive motivation, speed, innovation, and a results-oriented, high-performing culture. We believe that culture is not just about principles, but also behaviors. This belief can be seen and felt in everything we do as Signalites.

Day-to-Day 

  • Lead design discussions where you're able to lend your technical expertise
  • Brainstorm ideas to address various open-ended questions that the Assessment Platform (and the company as a whole) is tackling
  • Build, oversee, and improve workflows to validate the correctness of interview content, import it to the CodeSignal platform, and ensure display fidelity
  • Develop tools to maintain the high quality and fairness of our assessment frameworks, share insights discovered with the help of these tools with relevant teams within the company

Basic Qualifications

  • At least 4 years of professional, full-time software engineering experience
  • Clear and effective communication skills
  • Drive and initiative for getting things done
  • Available to work full-time. If remote, some timezone overlap during regular business hours with our San Francisco and Yerevan based teams is required.

Bonus Points for the Following

  • Experience with mid to large-scale projects in TypeScript and/or Python

Why You’ll Love It Here

  • 💰 Competitive salaries based on local market, and 401(k) match for U.S. based-employees

  • 🩺  Medical, dental, and vision insurance

  • 🥳  Team activities and get-togethers to connect with your fellow Signalites

  • 🏝  Unlimited PTO and remote-first work policy

  • 📚  Continuous learning with educational reimbursements provided

  • 💻  Equipment provision and generous home office setup stipend

  • 💙 A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join a fast-growing SaaS company

We know that great work comes from great, and inclusive teams. At CodeSignal, we specifically look for individuals of varying strengths, skills, backgrounds, and ideas. We believe this gives us a competitive advantage to better serve our customers and helps us all grow as Signalites and individuals. We hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status. CodeSignal is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Salary Projection

In accordance with local regulations in jurisdictions where CodeSignal may hire, we are projecting an annual base salary in the range of USD$100,000-250,000. This range is based on San Francisco benchmarks and encompasses all seniority levels eligible for this position. Offer packages often contain additional compensation in the form of commission or performance bonuses, equity, and/or benefits. Offers are awarded on an individual basis and are subject to factors such as, without limitation, a candidate’s level of experience, growth trajectory, and local labor market. Employees' compensation is reviewed and adjusted regularly.

results.title: Crypto Treasury Manager
results.description:
Our client is a rapidly growing iGaming Crypto business is which is looking for a highly motivated Treasury Manager to work in a highly visible role working alongside senior staff members. This individual will be analytical and able to work under pressure, thriving on the excitement of challenge. The role is Remote, preferably based in Malta.

This individual has strong relationship management skills, knowledge of payment operations and accounting principles, and experience in Cash Management and Liquidity. Management in Treasury Front, Middle and Back Office roles.

Responsibilities:

  • Knowledge and experience in Back, Middle and Front Office.
  • Supporting bank administrations.
  • Oversee / Manage all payment processes, ensuring standardisation and efficient structures in place.
  • Develop and implement onboarding processes and procedures of cash management and reporting, as well as regular treasury reporting.
  • Maintain reporting on PSP’s risk matrix.
  • Manage outstanding balances, regularly confirm balances due, manage escalations.
  • Work collaboratively and lead other Treasury team members as needed.
  • Allocating funds from hot to cold wallets, setting up a multi signature system if needed.

Requirements:

  • Have experience in Corporate Treasury at a multinational level, with strong technical knowledge.
  • Strong written and spoken English.
  • Exposure to cryptocurrency and PSPs.
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Business is preferred.

results.title: Recruiter – Attorneys (Partners & Groups)
results.description:
Offit Kurman is an Am Law 200 firm with 18 offices and approximately 280 attorneys. We are searching for a results driven attorney recruiter with a proven track record of successfully screening and placing partner level and lateral group candidates.

This recruiter will be responsible for account management of agency recruiter relationships to promote submission of partner and lateral group candidates as well as screening candidates received and providing recommendations to senior management. This individual will also be responsible for facilitating new agency relationships, participating in networking activities, and developing marketing strategies to further promote Offit Kurman across various regions.

Key Duties:

  • Manage, nurture, and facilitate 3rd party recruiting agency relationships, including contract negotiation, fee agreements, and serving as the main point of contact for agency partners.
  • Conduct initial interviews with attorney candidates to assess qualifications and fit within the firm.
  • Deliver robust notes and feedback on candidates to stakeholders within the firm.
  • Maintain an efficient and replenishing candidate pipeline specific to partner level candidates

Must have 3+ years of attorney recruiting experience from a law firm or recruiting company. The person hired can sit at any one of our offices. We will also consider remote candidates.

results.title: Blockchain/Solidity Developer
results.description:
Keyko is a Swiss based technology company focused on developing advanced solutions that promote the growth of Digital Ecosystems.

We offer unparalleled expertise in the creation and application of large scale Web3, cryptocurrency and data sharing technologies, and are a leader in data marketplaces leveraging decentralized open source platforms like Ethereum, Celo, Filecoin, Bancor, etc.

Keyko has a proven track record delivering complex Web3 and data sharing solutions encompassing access control, blockchains, smart contracts, Big Data, regulatory compliance, data governance and scalability.

With the knowledge, expertise, and proven success that Keyko offers, there is no competitive alternative on the global market for building advanced ecosystems.

We are looking for a new Sensei in our Dōjō: a Blockchain developer with strong experience in Solidity smart contracts development.

Our new Sensei will be able to work independently, liaising between technology and business. The role requires blending blockchain and Web3 solutions with traditional Web2 solutions. The Sensei must be driven to succeed, have an entrepreneurial mindset, and work well within the team.

Enter our Dōjō

● We are a Digital Ecosystems company looking to change the world!

● We are driven by our belief in Open Source to create communal value for all participants.

● We definitely take a technical orientation to everything we do, but we’re also business savvy and combine both to develop and realize true change agents.

● We are working to make the promise of Web3 a reality by merging legacy Web2 with new solutions.

● We like to think we’re pretty cool and fun… ;)

Responsibilities of our new Sensei

● Build technical solutions for Keyko and our partners through solution definition by encapsulating requirements, developing roadmaps, and understanding solution roll out needs.

● Deliver Solidity smart contracts and build Web3 applications.

● Perform smart contract security audits.

● Display an understanding of engineering backlogs and requirements gathering that help establish and oversee commitment to technical priorities.

● Understand how to incorporate specifications from business and product owners into engineering designs.

● Perform development and maintenance / support tasks on solutions.

● Identify gaps in solution designs and be able to recommend solutions.

Your obi (belt) designates

● Ability to work as a teammate for the good of the Dōjō.

● Over 5 years of software engineering experience with at least 3 years of professional blockchain development experience.

● Significant experience with secure Solidity development and the Ethereum ecosystem.

● Experience using smart contract auditing tools and techniques.

● Strong knowledge of Typescript and Hardhat.

● Experience with Web3 development libraries and technologies like Ethereum and EVM based blockchains.

Your obi (belt) may also designate

● Experience with ReactJS.

● Experience with ExpressJS.

● Experience with Node.js.

● Experience with Docker and Kubernetes.

● Experience with databases or search engines like PostgreSql / MongoDB / ElasticSearch.

● Experience with REST and/or GraphQL APIs.

 

What’s in the Dōjō?

● Competitive compensation.

● Work remote first model.

● Offsites, live events for the different teams (Lisbon, Berlin, Zurich, Spain).

● Fantastic teammates!

results.title: Business Analyst
results.description:
DefinedTalent is proud to be supporting an organization that helps some of the world’s leading companies deploy talent across the globe and transform their mobile workforce into the most dynamic and valuable segment of their employee population.

As a Business Analyst (Remote), you will be responsible for understanding business needs through meetings with stakeholders and users, creating the vision for the solution, gathering user requirements, as well as creating functional and technical requirement documents, project plans, and client presentations and communications. The Business Analyst ensures stakeholders and users are intimately involved in the final solution design.

***Remote***

***This candidate must have experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O)***

Responsibilities:
  • Improves business processes and supports critical business strategies by directing the development and implementation of business systems like Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&O)
  • Analyzes the needs of the finance and accounting departments for feasibility studies, system design, and implementation to develop new and/or modify processes.
  • Conducts process workshops resulting in more efficient, repeatable, and reproducible work and materials flow.
  • Formulates project scope documents, estimates costs, and ensures projects meet timelines and strategic needs.
  • Directs and oversees all aspects of project management and analysis including design and release.
  • Actively monitors new technologies and assess their applicability to the business.
  • Performs other duties as assigned

Requirements

  • Experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (Dynamics FNO)
  • Background in a Finance or Accounting environment and understanding of financial subjects, accounting, tax laws, money market, and business environments
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge of project management principles, practices, and techniques
  • Excellent presentation skills and ability to present to a large and diverse audience, as well as to a small group
  • Ability to lead continuous improvement initiatives
  • Strong oral and written communications skills and an ability to manage and build strong relationships
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of products
  • 5-7 years of experience, with a focus on project management and technology implementation/integration
  • High school diploma or GED / Bachelor’s degree strongly preferred

The salary range for this position is up to $110,000.00 - $135,000.00.
Final salary is competitive and commensurate with experience.

*Candidate must be legally authorized to work in the United States.
*Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.
*Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Benefits

  • Training & Development
  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
  • Work From Home

results.title: Admin Assistant/Office Manager
results.description:
The Sikh Research Institute is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization seeking to develop a principle-driven community by protecting the core and enlarging the resource pool. The Institute's mission is ‘to facilitate training and development while inspiring Sikh values, create global awareness of Sikhī, and deliver solutions to the key challenges faced by the Sikh community.'

Qualifications

  • Strong analytical writing, proofreading, and editing skills
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Office administration skills
  • Some web site development and familiarity with web technology
  • Creativity and a sense of humor
  • Ability to work well under pressure, and adapt well to the changing needs of a growing non-profit organization.



Responsibilities

1. Assist the Executive Director with daily administrative tasks, such as replying to and categorizing email correspondence and scheduling meetings, events, and presentations
2. Collect and compile information from files, references, and research materials for the organization databases. Oversee the follow-through with contact and donor databases.
3. Replying to general inquiries sent to the Institute by its supporters and the general public. 
4. Assisting the accountant on finance-related administrative tasks. 
5. Maintain relationships with vendors for office-related services.
7. Coordinating volunteers and interns.
8. Assist with special projects as needed and perform other duties as required to facilitate the operations and activities of the organization.

Additional Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in community building, education, international relations, developmental NGO, public policy, political science, or related. Previous work with a similarly sized organization in the nonprofit sector is a plus. Strong research, analytical, writing, and organizing skills. Demonstrated ability to work individually and as part of a hard-working and creative team. Demonstrated facility in a Windows environment using word processing, spreadsheet and database software., as well as some website experience. Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills and excellent oral and written communication skills are a must.

results.title: Strategic Account Executive
results.description:
Vivun is a global provider of Buyer Experience (BX) software. Its AI-powered platform supports a family of products that enables B2B businesses to meet the demands of today’s sales-proof buyer, differentiate from the competition, and accelerate revenue. With PreSales at the forefront of the buyer experience, companies can align Sales with Product, provide repeatable workflows for their solution experts, deliver on-demand product expertise, and win more deals with transparency and trust.
 
Position Summary:
 
The Strategic Enterprise Account Executive cultivates and closes new Enterprise-level relationships, specifically with accounts above 2500 employees, quarterbacking deals from start to finish. This role will be a hybrid of net-new relationships and existing growth within targeted accounts. The ideal candidate will be curious by nature, a relentless hunter, and possess a consistent track record of sales over-achievement.
 
What's in it For You:
 
You'll work for the company who is creating a new industry; you’ll sell products that you believe in; you’ll help introduce change to the way your customers live and work; you’ll work with competitive commission and stock plan structures that reward your efforts; and you’ll experience career growth and opportunity based on personal achievement.
 
This position reports to the VP of Sales.
 



Key Responsibilities
  • Be a driving force in the success of the company’s goals & objectives through achieving & exceeding individual sales quota
  • Qualify sales opportunities based on Vivun’s sales methodology & metrics, to include customer fit and success criteria
  • Identify, cultivate and close on net-new business as well as manage existing relationships to ensure customer renewals and retention
  • Build account plans and strategies for each target account
  • Effectively leverage internal resources (Senior Executives, PreSales, Account Management, Legal etc.) in Sales Campaigns
  • Work effective with your peers at Vivun’s key partners to deliver joint value propositions
  • Uncover needs and develop relationships with multiple stakeholders within the assigned accounts across the Lines of Business, IT, Procurement and Senior Management
  • Develop, strategize, negotiate and close business
  • Consistently seek new business opportunities by presenting, recommending and upsell new Vivun’s products. 
  • Accurately forecast sales activity and revenue achievement through proper use of sales tools



Desired Skills & Experience
  • 6+ years of direct enterprise level sales experience in a quota-carrying software sales role
  • Track record of over-achieving quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions
  • Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles, including prior success in closing 1M deals and managing multiple large accounts
  • Strong portfolio of C-Level contacts within Enterprise Accounts across a variety of accounts
  • Experience in dealing with customers either in person or remotely (sales specific experience a plus)
  • Experience building out and executing account plans into a referenceable number of Fortune 100 companies. 



You Are
  • A believer in Vivun’s core values: Ownership. Empathy.  We, not me.  Transparency.  Be different.
  • Experienced working in high growth startup environments: You have the ability to move fast, adapt, and thrive in a dynamic startup environment where you derive priorities, requirements, and goals from company context.
  • Collaborative: You are ready to roll up your sleeves and create strategies that work across roles and departments to achieve company goals. 
  • A Clear Communicator: You effectively and positively present your informed opinions on strategy clearly to multiple teams and areas of expertise. You come with a solid rationale behind every decision you make, you understand the importance of listening as part of communication.



What You Will Have at Vivun
  • Competitive salary and full health benefits
  • Stock Options at a well funded, pre-IPO company on a fast growth track
  • Flexible work schedules and work from anywhere at a fully remote company
  • Unlimited PTO with two weeks designated as “quiet period” each year
  • An experienced team who will fight beside you in the trenches to accomplish your goals

results.title: Director, Sales
results.description:
Sora is seeking a Director of Sales to coach our Sales team and build out/hone our sales processes, team, and culture.

 

About Sora

Sora’s mission is to empower people-focused teams to create exceptional employee experiences. These teams should be spending time with people, but unfortunately all facets of People teams are bogged down by managing processes instead of helping people. That’s where Sora comes in: we’re building a product that streamlines the tedious and repetitive work People teams do every day, from sending emails to assigning onboarding tasks to a new hire’s manager to syncing data across anywhere from 3 to 20 tools in a customer’s HR stack.

We’re a pure startup, with all the excitement that carries as a foundational member, but with more thoughtfulness than the typical early-stage company. We’re committed to our values and we take our mission seriously. Employee experience is in our DNA — we invest in processes that are inclusive and fair, and we invest in our long-term mental, physical, and emotional health.

Sora was founded in late 2018 and launched in 2020. We’ve fundraised from some of the best investors in the world and prioritize keeping a diverse group of investors and advisors.

Sora is committed to being a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

 

About the team

Our Sales team is full of good listeners and problem solvers. We’re lucky to work with and sell to empathetic, thoughtful people that are bought into our mission and committed to making a difference for employees at their companies. We sell by building relationships with great people and being genuine about how we can solve real problems for them.

 

We get to work closely with every single team at Sora to inform our product roadmap, ensure a smooth transition from sales to customer onboarding, help marketing with messaging that resonates with customers, and more.

 

We live all over the country and (outside of COVID) love to get together for board games, surfing, cooking, Mario Kart, and more :)

 

About the role

Sora has lots of early signs of product/market fit (e.g., we have amazing logos that rave about us and have produced some great case studies), and we have a huge opportunity to solidify our place in the HR tech market and grow exponentially from here.

 

To do this, you’ll work with our CEO (our Head of Sales) to own the entire sales funnel, working to meet our goals by optimizing and finding repeatability in all parts of the sales process. You’ll create and iterate on a sales process that is consistent and scalable, from prospecting to closing. You’ll manage our existing team of two BDRs, one AE, and one Sales Engineer — coaching and motivating them to success. You’ll own sales forecasting, and ensure that the Sales team and the rest of the organization has access to our Sales metrics (defined and monitored by you) and understands how we’re tracking toward our goals. And as we’re ready to scale, you’ll get to recruit and ramp a team full of empathetic, relationship-building, passionate salespeople.

 

You’ll learn the ins and outs of our product and speak to customers so you can keep a pulse on our process and suggest improvements. And you’ll interface with every department at Sora: 

  • You’ll work with Marketing to work on messaging, lead qualification, targeting optimization, etc. 

  • You’ll work with Customer Success to ensure smooth customer onboarding handoffs and make sure customers are set up for success from the beginning. 

  • You’ll be proactive and communicative about all prospective customer needs, working closely with the Product team, so we can be constantly evaluating and improving our product/market fit.

 

You’ll be the #1 advocate for Sora externally and steer the revenue ship to our success!

 

Behaviors we’re looking for

  • Owning outbound strategies to increase our top of funnel

  • Excellent management skills, including a ton of coaching and delivering candid and helpful feedback

  • Willingness to get your hands dirty: joining calls, understanding the product and our value proposition inside and out, reading contracts closely, and showing the team what it means to work smart

  • Introducing rigor into our processes and thinking about how we can iterate (first with lowest hanging fruit then anything else we can) to increase our conversion rates at every step and create a repeatable process

     

Relevant experience

  • 2+ years sales management experience

  • Direct SaaS closing experience

  • Experience with a wide range of ACVs ($10K-100K+)

  • Experience using, designing, and generating reporting through Salesforce

  • Proven track record of meeting and/or exceeding revenue quotas

  • Experience at early and middle stage startups

 

Benefits

  • Comprehensive health coverage ($0 deductible PPO plans): Sora covers 99% of individual monthly premiums for all employees, and 50% of dependent monthly premiums.

  • 401(k) with 3% direct company contribution: Sora deposits 3% of an employee's annual salary into their 401k, regardless of whether the employee is making individual contributions or not (so, essentially this is free money!).

  • Remote-first culture: A flexible work environment enabling our people to to do their best work.

  • Unlimited paid time off: We highly encourage at least 4-6 weeks.

  • $300/month Flexible Remote Work Stipend: These funds can be used towards a variety of remote work expenses.

  • Commuter benefits: To use if you're commuting to/from a co-working space.

  • Parental leave: 16 weeks of fully paid parental leave to all parents (regardless of family formation) with the option to extend 1 additional month at reduced pay.

  • In-person co-working weeks and retreats: 3 times a year we offer the opportunity for everyone to get together in-person in a different city in the US. Most recently, we brought folks to Austin for our annual retreat!

  • Ginger or Headspace: Anyone enrolled in Sora's health insurance should have access to a choice of either Ginger OR Headspace through Blue Shield.

  • Maven: Anyone enrolled in Sora's health insurance plans through Blue Shield should have access to Maven, an app that offers comprehensive care for everyone planning, starting, and raising a family.

  • Monthly stipend for coffee chats: We keep you connected with your co-workers by facilitating random pairings and encouraging you to meet (remotely ) for coffee, lunch, or donuts.

     

Ready to apply?

If you share our values and feel this role could be for you, we’d love to review your application! We promise we do take the time and care to review every application we receive. However, as much as we wish we could interview everyone who submits an application, we cannot guarantee an interview or feedback due to the volume of applications we are receiving today. We are rooting for you, and hope you do consider applying.

Note: You'll need valid U.S. work authorization to join us. 

Please note that a background check and employment verification will be required for this position. We may obtain one or more background screening reports about you, solely for employment purposes.
